website_summaries.verdict: If you need to dehumidify an especially large space, or hate having to stop and empty out the moisture reservoir several times a day, this large 70-pint dehumidifier is exactly what you need.
pros: Easily removes up to 70 pints of moisture from the air each day
Dehumidifies areas up to 4500 square feet
cons: While this may be a fairly expensive model, it’s worth the money for the expanded coverage

customer_reviews.title: One year wonder
customer_reviews.text: Failed after 1 year; really 1 season. Used in a basement that only needs dehumidifying during the summer. Next year it turned on but no water removal at all. Compressor seems to be running but no drain water at all. Bought in 2017; failed in 2018.
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: Terrible dehumidifier! Less than a year old and within ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible dehumidifier! Less than a year old and within an hour or two the bottom third is covered in frost. The automatic defrost feature is totally useless. I use it in a finished basement with no leaks or water at all and it struggles to lower the humidity level by even 10%.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fulfs

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS ALL OVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this item. I wanted to have a dehumidifier to remove the dampness in a room in our home. Instead, I received a machine that removes the water from the air and leaks all over my carpeting! I even followed all the directions about making sure the machine was level. I thought if I put the machine on a Rubbermaid pan it would help by catching the "small" amount of water, but it wasn't a small amount! The think leaks so much! I would not purchase this item at all!!
customer_reviews.author: mrsgfhjr

customer_reviews.title: WAY too loud for common use
customer_reviews.text: Pulls moisture very well but the rattles / vibration noise would not be acceptable if this were in a frequented area of my house. I've only owned one other large dehumidifier (a Kenmore) but it was much more quiet. Before buying, I had read some reviews where people said it was loud and some where they said it was not - guess mine came from the loud factory. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: B Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Poor Manual
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived and is defective. Will post pictures tomorrow after I run to Home Depot to get a dehumidifier. There are no instructions in the manual that address the plastic piece that must be installed correctly in the water collector. It was sitting in the unit. I had to watch the "video" and saw half way through that the plastic water detector had a plastic piece missing so it would not sit in the unit as needed. So P2 error message is what I saw. Tried to use Amazon return online but was not allowed to also get a refund on the 1 day shipping of over $25 and the insurance I paid for as well.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingWoman

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidifies but instruction manual is poor.
customer_reviews.text: It does get lots of humidity out of the basement. But I have not yet figured out how to set the humidity level on the controls. The instructions are literally about one page. So five stars for dehumidifying, and one star for instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Carlisle, PA

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, poor design.  Once leaking is solved unit performs well.
customer_reviews.text: Hose attachment leaks and is cheap and poorly designed. Leaky hose fill bucket quickly making unattended use impossible. After several reattachment attempts I was able to get it to finally not leak and the unit is performing well. Poor hose connection design led to much lost time and frustration. I recommend that the manufacturer go to a universal screw on hose with rubber washer design.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Eversun

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidifer did fine for the first few months
customer_reviews.text: Dehumidifer did fine for the first few months. Removed a lot of moisture from our home. Bought in early summer. Now it's October and it is constantly shutting off with P2 code showing on the screen. We have cleaned the filter, empty the container, repositioned the reservoir. Nothing. Runs for 30 seconds then quits again. Wouldn't recommend this dehumidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Burch

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional setting choices
customer_reviews.text: This product advertises a "timer," but it only runs down once and does not reset. There is no use in that. Also,the fan has one setting: continuous, so that it never shuts off even when the compresses does. It is advertised as having an energy star rating, but where is the energy savings in that? I have bought 3 dehumidifiers in the last 13 years and never had a unit as energy unfriendly as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing device. Can't wait to see how much moisture ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this today......Plugged in and turned on.......read the little book. Within 2 Hours my room went from 64% to 52% and the water reservoir was 1/2 full. This thing does the job. It is very quiet for how hard it is working. What an amazing device. Can't wait to see how much moisture it pulls out of the air tomorrow morning. My goal is to use the hose connection and have this just drain into an out side drain or plumb it into a drain. From what I am seeing, this needs to be going 24/7. Will keep you updated. NOTE: When arrived...this beast is HEAVY!
customer_reviews.author: John B. Hartleb

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.... Terrible Delivery by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Ivation 70 Pint Energy Star Dehumidifier I have bought. They do an excellent job. If I need a third one today I'd buy another Ivation. But Amazon's contracted delivery rates a -2 on a scale of 1-10. Driver left an electronic product and another item barely sheltered (about 6" from the wetted area) while it was raining. Third time this has happened with the new delivery drivers. Complained directly to Amazon last time but all contact numbers appear to have been removed from their website.
customer_reviews.author: Tn_Boy

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 season only
customer_reviews.text: 10 months old and frosts up within 30 minutes. Floor temp 66, air temp 70 Useless now, worked great last year going to email Ivation today
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honorable Company that stands behind the product and has your back
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked great for 3.25 months then began to leak. Notified Ivation and they replaced it within 4 days with an upgraded unit. Company was very responsive and even covered postage. I own 2 of the upgraded units now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup
customer_reviews.text: Really frustrating setup. Difficult to fit hose into back side of fitting and then push on enough to screw to back of cabinet. Screw holes are too small and screw heads strip easily. I had to enlarge holes and replace one screw I stripped. After spending way to mush time on assembly it seems to work fine. I give three out of frustration for poor engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Reed

customer_reviews.title: If your on a well like us, you'll need mineral free water in a ...
customer_reviews.text: We are using this in our basement. We use the water it gathers in our TAO Heated Humidifiers upstairs, mainly to keep the floors at proper humidity. If your on a well like us, you'll need mineral free water in a heated humidifier otherwise you will create a dust-vapor that will permeate everything in the room (a white dust powder). A water distiller will do it for you... and so will the water from this de-humidifier. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: oneminuteblues

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I just rexeived this hnit yesterday and so far I am very impressed. I have a swamp cooler and relatively new hardwood floors and was advised by the installers to invest in a good dehumidifier. My house is 1200 sq ft and this unit is perfect for that size. It's working so efficiently that I have had to empty it 4 times in 2 days. I love the fact that it has an auto shut-off feature when it's full. I spent more money than I originally planned but it's worth it. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Mooney

customer_reviews.title: so not very happy could be a fluke but no one wants to ...
customer_reviews.text: Well It seems to work ok. But the thing leaks on my floor and I can't seem to find why it is leaking, leaking from day one about one hour after I plugged it in. so not very happy could be a fluke but no one wants to help fix the isses!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: I bought it to use on my boat to keep humidity down and it works great. I have installed the hose bib and am ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third dehumidifier. I bought it to use on my boat to keep humidity down and it works great. I have installed the hose bib and am able to run without tending the collection tank. The only drawback to this is if/when I would like to go back to original configuration, I will need to take some time to remove the hose bib. Personally I do not anticipate the need to do this.
customer_reviews.author: James Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Talk about a little GIANT!!
customer_reviews.text: Connect this sucker to a 50 gallon drum and be AMAZED on how good it does! Being used in a large basement with lots of humidity all year around.. and guess what?? I have been running it 24/7 for 3 MONTHS NOW!!!!!!!! Yesh.. buy meow.
customer_reviews.author: Imburne

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy Product
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this item. I recently had water problems occur in my basement and needed a reliable fast working machine. This item takes water out of the air so fast I connected a continuous draining hose to my sump pump. Really does take about 8 gallons of water out of the air in 24 hours. Now my basement is dry, I just run it on automatic with it's internal 1 gallon collection bucket. Runs very quiet like a low fan. So glad to always have something now that I can depend on to work well.
customer_reviews.author: BryteVisuals

customer_reviews.title: leaking some kind of goo
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 3 months ago. It worked fine at first. I set it up to drain to the sump in the basement. About a month ago, it kept stopping due to the reservoir filling up. It would no longer drain through the hose. I pulled the hose off to check for clogs, and a grayish goo came out of the drain. The only parts that I can get to - filters & reservoir -are clean. The goo is coming from an area that is only accessible by disassembly.
customer_reviews.author: DaJamster

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived undamaged and, well packaged. So far this is an excellent unit, I set it up in our basement and within a few days it had the humidity down to 50%. Also the operating noise is low enough that we are not aware of it running if we are upstairs or in one of the other rooms in the basement with the doors open between rooms.
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly in my awful and damp basement. It is now a comfortable living space. Set up was easy. We purchased a drain hose separately, so no need to empty the reservoir. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use just plug it into the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. Simple to operate as it is pretty much out of the box and plug it in. Has helped bring humidity in the house down to between 35 - 40%. The house feels much cooler without turning down the thermostat. Only drawback when first put to use used the continuous setting to bring down the humidity and was rather noisy. Once desired humidity was achieved turned it to maintain which seems quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent extraction, too noisy after a month of continuous use...
customer_reviews.text: The filter is difficult to remove, it is an awesome dehumidifier, noise level and intermittent hesitations while in continuous mode are bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Brooks-Ondeck

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 dehumidifiers. This one is the smaller of the 2, but seems to be the most powerful. Have to empty it everyday. It is relatively quiet and very easy to move. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Have a walk in crawl space that was encapsulated, and was still a little musty smelling. Have been using every day for a couple of months now with no problems. I did set up for continuous drainage, which works great. Fro those who said there were no screws, they were in with the instructions. Keeps the humidity at 40% or less.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Dependable. Noticeably drier air quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple dehumidifier. It takes water out of the air. It has a simple on / off function, or you can set the room to your desired level of dryness and let it take care of the rest. There is also an option to hook up a hose to drain right to a floor drain (highly recommended), or you can use the bucket (but you might be emptying multiple times a day).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schneider

customer_reviews.title: *******Great Unit!!!********
customer_reviews.text: Usually don't leave reviews but WOW! I have a 30x50 garage and this unit dropped the humidity in the whole building down 4% in just 30 minutes! Im very impressed so far and I know 30 minutes of use isn't enough time to give true feedback but I'm just blown away. If im in any way less satisfied I will update this review! Don't hesitate folks, this thing is a BEAST!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Bit loud
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Seems to be a bit louder than ones I’ve seen in the past. Especially if on basement concrete or if not level. Does freeze up from time to time, but we have been running to a direct drain and it goes 24/7 to try drying up our new house and wood floors warping. It’s working! Floors have mostly come down.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer RB

customer_reviews.title: Easy and no leakage
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one of these about a week after the first one, they work exactly as advertised. Easy and no leakage. I live in a very wet area of Hawaii and have a large piano that does not like high humidity, I bought the to solve that problem and it has. I'd give it 10 stars if they were available!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley L.

customer_reviews.title: Humidity and noise levels issues
customer_reviews.text: The dehumidifier is working great. The only negative thing I have to say is, the humidity can not adjustable. I was under the impression the humidity level can be set at what ever level. The fixed value is fifty percent humidity. Dehumidifier can be very noisy if not position right. This is very hard to explain. The noise come from the condensation drawer rattling inside dehumidifier storage position. While the unit is running position dehumidifier to where the rattling noise stops.
customer_reviews.author: William E Emeny

customer_reviews.title: Great Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier was easy to setup and is working great. My husband does custom airbrush painting and our basement was too humid to paint. This product has reduced the humidity way down so painting is possible again.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Ahlschlager

customer_reviews.title: Works great...own two
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit noisy at first, but quickly becomes white noise. I have bought two of these and recommended to a neighbor. Very low maintenance and works like a charm. Works best in an open floor plan. I have two, as my house is divided. Keeps the house at about 50% humidity even on the worst of days
customer_reviews.author: C. Lavine

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Had under my house encapsulated and needed a dehumidifier to bring down the humidity. This one was able to drain directly into my sump to be pumped out as needed and is working well so far.
customer_reviews.author: dalewick

customer_reviews.title: Working well but fan noisy. Good value for $
customer_reviews.text: Getting the job done in my 1200 sq foot log cabin. Keeping moisture down is a difficult task, due to airflow with 2 floors. My only complaint would be it is noisy, a better fan design would help this issue. Overall a good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Bush II

customer_reviews.title: Only had for 2 weeks but is doing a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something our old one. Spent some time reading reviews before choosing. It seems tey all have some issue sometimes. But this brand seem to have the least. Have only been using 2 weeks. Still need to hook up the hose . I empty at least 2 times a day. Amazing the amount of water you get.
customer_reviews.author: muff

customer_reviews.title: I have an industrial photo studio located in a warehouse ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an industrial photo studio located in a warehouse in south Florida. Some of the items we paint were getting a mottled look because of the intense humidity. This dehumidifier has made a world of difference to our work.
customer_reviews.author: skalka

customer_reviews.title: Advertized as 70 pint - box says it is 50 pint formally labeled as 70
customer_reviews.text: Requires two screws to set up for continues drain - I could not find them although the instructions said they were included. Cannot give valid review for a while. I have had very bad luck with dehumidifiers in the past 10 years. Old sears lasted 25+ years. All replacements have been made in China and have lasted between 1 and 4 years. We will see if this one does better
customer_reviews.author: Giorgisshop

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works great
customer_reviews.text: The product worked like they described. The only thing that I had an issue with was the wheels. I know the wheels are for easy maneuverability but I wanted to have it stay in one place because I was putting it on a wall shelf and didn't want it to fall off. I think the wheels should be easier to take off. (I believe can be taken off?) but I cut my fingers trying to slide the wheels off.
customer_reviews.author: henry

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than two months and now exchange is being made difficult! Same unit is sold under different names, beware!
customer_reviews.text: Ivation 70 Pint dehumidifier ran less than 2 months. Now they offer an exchange but I have to figure out how to box it up and return it to them at my expense. Not sure if it is worth the time and money for another piece of junk. I've bought dehumidifier after dehumidifier and they all have an early death. This one is identical to one I bought before but they changed the name of the unit so you'd buy another one. Why can't anyone make a unit that works for at least five years? Last one was an Arctic Aire but it was the same unit and also failed early.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Dehumidifier For Damp Basements
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one due to prior one not working well, old and not energy efficient either. This is a huge difference to our basement to perfect humidity levels. It runs 24/7 for a 1500 square foot basement. Stays pretty much between 39-42% I highly suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: Value Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product commercial results
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after a rental home flooded 430,000 gallons of water flowed thru the basement and out the seller door. After a submerseble pump drained the remaining water we set this up to remove remaining humidity levels. Completely happy with the results it provided us.
customer_reviews.author: Levis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my office and it works wonders!!! We have to empty it 3-4 times during the work day because it pulls so much moisture out of the air. We went from having moisture on desks, damp carpet, curling paper - all gross! - to a perfectly dry office. I'm considering purchasing one for my home.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyDB

customer_reviews.title: Energy Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1400 sq ft 3 ft tall damp crawl space. I have been using this dehumidifier for 2 months now and has brought humidity from 90% to between 60 and 70%. My crawl space has vents shut but is not encapsulated “yet” I believe this machine can do better when crawlspace is sealed of better. Very happy and seems to be very efficient since it runs all the time. I understand there are dehumidifiers designed for crawl spaces but for the money and being able to use drain hose to get rid of the water you really can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Watsom

customer_reviews.title: Basement Use
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I have been running the dehumidifier in my unfinished basement for 1 month to date. The basement is 800 sq ft with a 1000 sq ft crawl space walled off. The product maintains a constant 35-45 % humidity level in the basement, and keeps the other 2 stories under 45%. Quite pleased with the products performance. The best part is that it comes with a drain hose for continuous operation instead of emptying the bucket and also has a washable air filter. I am eager to see how long this product will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works in colder temperatures and does not require a heated basement.
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier is working in a cold basement. The last dehumidifier we purchased worked only when the temperatures were in the upper 40's. Our basement is not heated and we are happy that we found a dehumidifier that works when the temperatures drop.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Marie

customer_reviews.title: Removes humidity easily
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the humidity at 46%. What a difference in the basement now. Never have to worry about the container filling up. Installed the hose bib and run the hose into the sump pump.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really like this dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple of weeks now and it seems to work great. My parents basement leaks during heavy rains and it was getting pretty musty smelling due to an old dehumidifier that, after years of use, just wasn't doing the job. Since putting this in their basement it smells and feels soooooo much better. I would recommend this dehumidifier to friend/family without thinking twice about it.
customer_reviews.author: Never delivered

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: This definitely keeps our basement humidity free and gets rid of the stanky musty smell danky basements have. Works well but it is a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office area which is approximately 2k sq. ft.. It works really well and quickly lowered the humidity in the air shortly after it was installed. The 70 pint container was filled in about 6 hours! I haven't owned it long enough to comment on reliability but it seems to be well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Heck

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product at a decent price and not too loud.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, with good reviews. I could not find this dehumidifier locally, so ordered it from Amazon. The controls are not completely intuitive. The 40+ year old dehumidifier (which died) was easier to set, but did not have the more extensive settings. This new dehumidifier has a filter which can be cleaned, which should prove to be useful. Keeping the unit pretty level seems to be important. So far, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jim-in-mn

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I had dehumidifier for 11 years and it finally died. After doing my research I find it this dehumidifier, which in many ways resembles my previous one. I turn it on when I go to bed, (i used as kind of background noise) , and it is doing wonderful job. I live in very humid environment and in 2 days tank is almost full. So far I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mari K.

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that works!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Oct. 18, 2016. So far so good. I have it in my sealed crawlspace, and have a wireless humidity monitor. The readings have been consistently 51-52% the entire time. So happy, I struck out with Frigidaire(kept freezing up) and Danby never worked right. Finally have one that works!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Moisture Issue Buy The Answer
customer_reviews.text: We love this! It takes care of our upper level of the home pretty well. Will be buying another for our basement in May.
customer_reviews.author: Leda Rose Dumond

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier was installed in the basement of a church. It has run nearly constantly for a month and has no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has not been in service long enough to rate.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it on Aug. 14th 2020 and set it upright for 28 hrs. How can one review an dehumidifier when in service for 4 days? I purchased a different brand dehumidifier through Amazon in May and it lasted 3 months. When will US and other companies learn to have durable and quality dehumidifiers?
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaking, can't be fixed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and right after the warranty window it started leaking. The manufacturer doesn't even fix it for a charge, and neither does the local Sears (also called several other places, none of which were willing/able to fix it). Tried several different, obvious things to fix after googling some suggestions, but nothing worked. Might be ok if you are luckier with a model that actually works for more than 1+ year, but don't expect to have it fixed by the manufacturer. So the $260+ investment is thrown out the window and have to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ziegenbock

customer_reviews.title: We have 2400 Sq. ft living area that is ...
customer_reviews.text: We have 2400 Sq. ft living area that is being is having the moisture level decrease drastically. Permanent press clothing can be hung on hangers after washing. Dries quick because of the low moisture content inside the home. Job well done.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Came with no damages & as described. Not that noisy or difficult to move. Did what i expected & no issues after 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Zatara

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Daaaaamn this sucks liquid out the room like Phil's mom on these NUUUUUTS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Robbins

customer_reviews.title: easy to set levels of moisture
customer_reviews.text: I set the comfort level and the dehumidifier maintains its level almost silently. It works to capacity doing an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Firefighter davis

customer_reviews.title: house no longer smells like the basement!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in hopes that my damp basement smell would no longer penetrate the entire house, 3500sq feet. I hooked it up and was emptying it 3 times a day! That became tedious so I used an old hose to have it drain directly into our sump pump. The machine has a humidity indicator on it and it has gone from 58% to 38% in less than a couple of days. The house feels less stuffy and the smell is gone!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann W Burns

customer_reviews.title: Quiet start & stop
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Not too noisy. Fast service --- didn't have a need to contact the shipper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but not the one ordered
customer_reviews.text: The unit came with out two pieces enclosed. The hose extension and the connector. Just the two screws. Label on the back looked like something had been placed over it. Ordered 70 pint and this was a 50 pint. Unit
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Marabello

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: This unit works better than advertised and is very easy to maintain. Worked well right out of the box and continues to produce excellent results. Highly recommend this unit, it is well made, durable and sucks the moisture right out of the air.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this when our other dehumidifier was surged. It works great. It seems to be more efficient than our previous one. Basement is much dryer.
customer_reviews.author: N. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier has worked great so far. I live in a tropical climate and it does a great job at decreasing the moisture level in the home. It’s easy to set up and use. It is a little noisy. I do not use it while sleeping. Overall I would buy this again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gibson

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks the moisture right out
customer_reviews.text: My basement was moist and depressing. After buying a cheap dehumidifier which was disappointing, I went with this unit based on reviews and the drain adaptor. This thing sucks the moisture right out! My depression has cleared and my basement is dry. Use the drain line if you can, otherwise you will be emptying this thing every 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Erich

customer_reviews.title: Does the job GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased three of these units for different homes and spaces. Quiet, energy efficient and takes out a ton of water. Easy to install hose for direct draining. Easy to move around as well. No more mustiness.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: Used this dehumidifier throughout the summer in my house. No problems. If I could change anything it would be the storage tank. It is a bit awkward to remove and empty when full without some spillage. But I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Gene G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work ...turns on for maybe a minute then turns off and wont turn back on... this unit didnt even take one drop of water out the air
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: The reviews I read were great in helping me make my decision to purchase this ...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read were great in helping me make my decision to purchase this product. My personal experience has been awesome. It arrived on time, packaged well with easy to follow instructions. The sound from the fan isn't annoying. It can not be heard on the upper level of my home (from the basement). The air smells much cleaner and it pulls moisture from the air daily. Removing the canister from the unit is just as easy as installing it. The automatic shut off and on works like a charm. I should have purchased this 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: erica l. solomon

customer_reviews.title: The basement is dry!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been in the basement for a week and we can tell the difference. The basement is dryer. The water container handle is plastic so I am waiting to see how long it lasts. It’s pretty quiet compared to the one I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Installed in our 1100 sq ft lake house and all musty odors were gone in a few days. Puts off very little heat and noise level is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: It makes a lots of noise never expected that much noise Because the advertising shows in the living room redals a lot I'm not happy with a purchase. I'll give it 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Manuel S.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I wish the drain hose was a little bit longer. It’s litwrally like 3 inches long, making it annoying to constantly have to dump when full. And I don’t have a garden hose.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Refalo

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Only have had a few days but reasonably quiet and the water collection bucket comes out smoothly. That is good!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Christoffel

customer_reviews.title: If you live in moist climates this is a must have
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 days the pull all moisture from downstairs basement. Now we run it only during the day and have been able to keep any moisture at a minimum
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: So great, and so fast.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I could not keep up with dumping the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Old Soul

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: The unit was great while it lasted. Died in 2 years and only used during the Spring and Summer. The fan still runs, but the humidity level in the basement remains above 60%.
customer_reviews.author: Technician4pc

customer_reviews.title: Works well but has become noisy
customer_reviews.text: The system works great and has done a fantastic job of reducing the humidity in the basement. Now 3 months in it is periodically making a lot of noise. It is still working, but you can hear it in every room of the house when it starts buzzing
customer_reviews.author: Maryland Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ, but they're has to be a dehumidifier you can use in the same room your in that doesn't have to be so noisy. Sound like a central heat and air condenser.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely

customer_reviews.title: I can't get the continual drain to work.
customer_reviews.text: Only problem the hose connect is very hard to get the plastic tube on the plastic receiver, I still havent been able to do it. The design is terrible to connect hose for continous dumping so I have to dump bucket every day. I finally connected the tube and it is still not continuously dumping.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: SOUNDS LIKE A FREIGHT TRAIN IDLING IN THE HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: Seems to get nosier by the day. So noisy it wakes up the whole house when it kicks on during the night. Pulled the plug on it at 3:30 this morning for the last time...can't carry it to the dump fast enough. Don't buy this item!!! Update: Warranty states within 6 months of purchase they will replace or issue full refund of purchase price. I purchased a GE replacement and requested the refund but am still on "ignore" 5 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Delahanty

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It is a tad nosey but works fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Alan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We've had this in our garage for about 6 months. Works great. We have a hose that runs into a drain, so no need to worry about emptying the bin. We get water in the garage during heavy rains, so it runs often.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Oliveri

customer_reviews.title: Not sensitive to humidity
customer_reviews.text: Working fine but not very sensitive to the humidity . Use either continuous or comfort mode.
customer_reviews.author: L. Weng

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Living in Ohio we have a lot of moisture in the basement and this sucks it up. Best purchase I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Liked the usit
customer_reviews.text: I personally would have preferred a larger collection pan, but I guess this in comparable to similar units everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur O. Pember

customer_reviews.title: One week in— love it!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only had it for a week, but it’s definitely working. The proof is in the pudding (the water you drain from it 5 or 6 hours later). Our basement (which has never had flooding issues, just standard “dank” basement odor) has improved in humidity and smell substantially. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Harris

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Really took the moisture out. Large and works over multiple rooms
customer_reviews.author: Baby K’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I really like this dehumidifier it is quite easy to move light. I wish though when full the sound peep could be louder that’s the only problem
customer_reviews.author: shar

customer_reviews.title: Pulls moisture from the air quickly and runs round the clock if necessary.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same model - by a different brand name - for several years. This dehumidifier is very reliable, quickly fills ups removing moisture and reducing the humidity (I use a humidity gauge) quickly. Very reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Hadsell

customer_reviews.title: amazing. It was set on continuous
customer_reviews.text: Has been running just a few days, brought humidity down from 76% into the teens, amazing. It was set on continuous, I think now I will change it to a set % and this thing will handle it with ease. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: So far works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up I connected a hose to the drain which goes outside. Is pulling the humidity from the basement, the last one lasted about 3 years (Walmart). I am selling the house so will not know-how this will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. My basement no longer feels or smells like a cave found in middle Earth. It's been about two months, no problems so far
customer_reviews.author: KAL-EL

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Addition to Our Basement
customer_reviews.text: The auto drain feature of this machine is a great feature. The instructions for connecting a drainage hose are a little vague but you can figure it out. Much more convenient then the models in which you have to remove the reservoir to dump the collected water.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: This dehumidifier does what it is supposed to do in ...
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier does what it is supposed to do in terms of removing moisture from the air. The problem I am having is that while the compressor shuts off, the fan stops running for only a few seconds at a time. This makes it unsuitable for occupied areas. This seems to be a common problem across many brands and models. Oh well......
customer_reviews.author: David F Zita

customer_reviews.title: Quiet operation
customer_reviews.text: The first week has gone very well. The operation instructions for the electric touch controls are very poor. You have to sort it out by yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Ole Soldier

product_meta.title: Ivation 4,500 Sq Ft Large-Capacity Energy Star Dehumidifier - Includes Humidistat, Hose Connector, Auto Shutoff/Restart, Casters & Air Filter
feature_bullets: This Compressor Dehumidifier Keeps Spaces Up to 4500 Sq. Ft. Cool & Comfortable by Removing 50 Pints of Moisture/Day (70 Pint according to the old DOE [Department of Energy] standards, in 2019 this was classified as 70 pint and it now needs to be classified as 50 pint but IT REMOVED THE SAME MOISTURE AS THE OLD 70 PINT)
Built-In Humidity Sensor - The LCD accurately displays the current humidity level in the room, enabling you to set your ideal levels for automatic moisture controlAllergens & Odors for Healthy Air
Low Maintenance & Easy Operation; Simply Plug-In, Select Settings & Empty 1.3 Gallon Reservoir
Bright LED Display Indicates Humidistat & Setting, Fan Speed, Timer, Filter Alert & More
Highlights Include Eco-Efficiency (ENERGY STAR Certified), Casters, Auto-Defrost, & Auto-Restart
